Review_Text: "Made in Senegal" is a Documentary in which we follow the inspiring journey of Sadio Mané, one of Africa's brightest football stars, and explores the universal themes of struggle, ambition, and success that resonate deeply with fans of the sport.I found this movie very inspiring and beautiful. The documentary presented very well Sadio Mané and his rise from humble beginnings in a small Senegalese village to become an international football sensation, symbolizing the classic hero's journey. His journey is not only about achieving success on the field but also about the sacrifices he makes along the way-leaving his family, facing poverty, and enduring hardships in pursuit of greatness, while afterwards giving back to his people and his country. The documentary captures both the joy and the pain of Sadio Mané's journey, offering a window into the culture of Senegal and the wider African football scene. His rise to stardom is not just about winning trophies but also about representing hope and pride for his community and continent. In conclusion, I have to say that "Made in Senegal" is a beautiful and inspirational documentary that highlights the perseverance and ambition shows the power of dreams and the unyielding determination required to achieve them so, I highly recommend everyone to watch it.
